blocks.heading: Deploy a **Dynamics 365** built to service you and your customers!
blocks.description:
Your customer data isn't structured.

Your teams lack visibility.

Everything feels very manual.

Your Dynamics 365 investment isnâ€™t delivering.

SSWâ€™s Dynamics experts tailor the platform to fit your unique business, not force your business to fit Dynamics. We can help drive Dynamics value, so your sales, service, and marketing teams can work as a team.

blocks.heading: Why Dynamics 365 configuration is critical to organisational success
blocks.description:
Many businesses jump into Dynamics 365 expecting instant clarity and ROI, only to find the default configuration doesnâ€™t reflect their real processes. When screens, fields, and workflows donâ€™t align with how your teams operate, adoption drops quickly with data quality following suit.

We shape Dynamics 365 around your business as we understand each organisations is as unique as fingerprints! We tailor the environment to match your sales cycle, your service model and help map your specific customer journey. The end result is a system that feels natural to your people. This drives better customer insights, consistent processes, and a CRM your teams actually trust.

features.heading: Workflow Automation
features.description: Automate repetitive workflows so your teams can focus on meaningful work. By automating tasks, approvals, and handovers, Dynamics reduces manual effort, removes bottlenecks and ensures every step of your process happens consistently. Automation means smoother operations across sales, service, and other key teams within your organisation.

features.heading: Capture Key User Information with a user friendly UI
features.description: Capture all essential customer information through a clean, intuitive interface. Our Dynamics experts can help customise your overall Dynamics UI design.  Users can enter the right data quickly without feeling overwhelmed. This ensures teams record accurate, complete details while still enjoying a simple, user-friendly experience that drives adoption and better insights.

cards.heading: A Single Source of Truth
cards.description: Dynamics centralises all customer interactions, communications, sales activity, cases, and history in one place. This gives your team complete visibility and reduces duplication, confusion, and lost information.

cards.heading: Increased Team Accountability
cards.description: With assigned tasks, SLAs, workflows, and activity tracking, every team member knows their responsibilities, which improves collaboration and removes ambiguity.

cards.heading: Seamless Microsoft Integration
cards.description: Native integration with Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, Power BI, and Microsoft Fabric ensures a unified digital workplace and reduces double handling.

cards.altText: AU  Skip navigation Search    Create   Avatar image SharePoint agents - What's new and what's next | Microsoft 365 Community Conference 2025
cards.heading: SharePoint agents - What's new and what's next
cards.description: In this session, we will recap key product best practices for getting the most out of SharePoint, OneDrive and custom agents with SharePoint Embedded. We'll also unveil our roadmap for the months ahead as we continue to innovate how agents support individual workers, teams, and organizations.

accordionItems.label: What's the difference between Dynamics configuration and customization?
accordionItems.content:
Different modules and components can be turned on/off within the Dynamics platform, that's configuration.

At SSW, we go further with customization: Our .NET developers can build bespoke solutions, integrations, and workflows that allows your Dynamics CRM to become the backbone of your business.

For example, perhaps you want new leads within Dynamics to be automatically routed to the right salesperson, but your internal routing rules depend on multiple factors such as industry, deal size, geo-location, lead score, product interest etc. Complex routing of this nature can be best achieved using custom plugins. Something our team excel at!

accordionItems.label: How long does a typical Dynamics implementation take?
accordionItems.content: It varies significantly based on scope. Simple implementations with out-of-the-box features (team sites, document libraries, basic workflows) can be deployed in weeks. Complex Enterprise solutions requiring custom development, legacy system integration, data migration and other factors can result in a project taking several months. During your initial meeting, we'll discuss your requirements and provide a realistic timeline. Our approach is transparent; we'll tell you exactly what's involved and how long each phase will take.

accordionItems.label: What happens in the free initial meeting?
accordionItems.content: Our sales manager and a SharePoint consultant will meet with you to understand your business requirements and current challenges. We'll discuss pain points like scattered documents, manual processes, or integration needs. Then we'll assess whether SharePoint is the right fit and provide honest recommendations. Many common business needs (expense claims, leave requests, approval workflows) can be handled with SharePoint's out-of-the-box features. For more complex scenarios, we'll explain how custom development can solve your specific challenges. There's no pressure or obligationâ€¦ just expert guidance to help you make the right decision.

accordionItems.label: Should we choose SharePoint Online or on-premises?
accordionItems.content: For most organizations, SharePoint Online (part of Microsoft 365) is the better choice. You eliminate server hardware, maintenance costs, IT overhead, and manual upgrades while gaining automatic updates, enterprise security, and global availability. However, some organizations with specific compliance requirements or legacy system dependencies may still need on-premises deployment. During your free initial meeting, we'll assess your specific needs and recommend the best approach for your situation.
